title: Spinal Surgery Robot Simulator Design and Utilization Training

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education specializing in medical robotics and surgical simulation, learning design processes with human-system integration theory

learning_goals: They can explain the core components and functionalities of a spinal surgery robot simulator.
They can analyze simulator design requirements applying Human-System Integration (HSI) theory.
They can conduct formative assessments to evaluate the correlation between pedicle screw insertion accuracy and simulation training.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
